intro: Verbascum novae-hollandiae, commonly known as the New Holland mullein, is a perennial herb native to Australia. It features tall, hairy stems that can grow up to 2 meters in height, supporting large, velvety leaves that are often used medicinally. The plant produces showy yellow flowers in clusters at the top of the stem, which bloom in spring and summer. Its leaves and flowers contain various bioactive compounds, making it valuable in traditional and modern herbal medicine. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas.
